black.content: When tools go missing, it's usually because of _.
I realized I knew nothing about construction when someone asked me to _.
Herb has the most noticeable hard-hat. It has a picture of _ on it.
Crap! What did my backhoe just hit? _
To get into any jobsite, all you need is a hard hat, clipboard, and _.
Wait, the contractor did _?
_ is not going to get my stamp of approval.
What was the architect's odd request this time? _
Union regulations now require construction workers to be provided with one _ each day.
Newest industry organization. The American Society of Concrete _.
No building inspection is complete without _.
Engineers usually don't design _.
My favorite interior design trend is _.
Who was last in the port-a-potty? There's a _ in there!

There was a tragic accident at the jobsite. Someone was injured by a flying _.
A good architect always finds a way to put _ in the building.
Oh no. Don't tell anyone we found _ while digging at the jobsite.

white: An oak tree well in the living room.
The overflowing pile of product brochures in my office.
Unnecessary requirement for Reduced Pressure Backflow Assembly.
Fans that can suck the ass out of a cat.
Plumbing products still proudly made in the USA.
A Native American arrowhead which has the power to cancel the entire project.
Punch list that the contractors weren't ready for.
Shit stored in front of electrical panels.
The architect changing his mind one too many times.
They did it, they own it.
Finding tobacco products on a church jobsite.
The American Society of Heating, Refrigerating, and Air-Conditioning Engineers (ASHRAE).
Plumbers with a little too much crack.
Getting stuck at a train crossing on bid day.
Locking refrigerant caps. Because kids get high on the refrigerant.
A spiral staircase in a mobile home.
Submittals as thick as your arm.
Hiding contraband beer cans in the ceiling.
Working in the right of way.
People who just don't show up to meetings.
Telling a contractor that a submittal is wrong for the 3rd time.
Not my project, not my problem.
Having to deal with idiot contractors.
Hot when there should be cold and cold when there should be hot.
Contractors who actually read the specification and did something I didn't mean them to do.
The nostalgic smell of an old moldy window air conditioner.
Equipment that has exceeded its useful life.
Designing a brewery? Where's my free beer?.
Bids that come in too high.
Spilling paint on the new floor.
Those dang Canadians and their quality construction.
Not putting my stamp on that drawing.
Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (TM).
Taco pumps and the debate over how to pronounce their name.
